intro: Cobana guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan cobana, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
